tasks.title: Add LICENSE file (MIT)
tasks.details: Create LICENSE file in repository root with MIT license text. Include current year and project name.
tasks.tests: LICENSE file exists at repo root with valid MIT license text

tasks.title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md
tasks.details: Create CONTRIBUTING.md covering: how to run tests (go test ./...), code style (go fmt), PR process, local development setup (go install ./cmd/ralph), and pointer to key directories (internal/, cmd/ralph/).
tasks.tests: CONTRIBUTING.md exists with sections for testing, style, PR process, and local dev setup

tasks.title: Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
tasks.details: Create CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md using the Contributor Covenant template (https://www.contributor-covenant.org/). Use version 2.1 which is the current standard.
tasks.tests: CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md exists with Contributor Covenant content

tasks.title: Add SECURITY.md
tasks.details: Create SECURITY.md with: supported versions (latest minor only), reporting instructions (GitHub security advisories or maintainer email), and expected response window (e.g., 48-72 hours acknowledgment).
tasks.tests: SECURITY.md exists and GitHub no longer shows 'No security policy detected' warning

tasks.title: Add Contributing section to README
tasks.details: Add a 'Contributing (5 min quickstart)' section near bottom of README.md with: go test ./..., go fmt ./..., local install command, and brief pointer to internal/ and cmd/ralph/ as core logic locations.
tasks.tests: README.md contains Contributing section with quickstart commands and directory pointers

tasks.title: Add PR template
tasks.details: Create .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md with checklist including: tests run, docs updated if needed, description of changes, and 'why' explanation field.
tasks.tests: New PRs automatically show template with checklist

tasks.title: Add issue templates
tasks.details: Create .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/ directory with: bug_report.md (expected/actual behavior, repro steps, version info) and feature_request.md (problem statement, proposed solution, acceptance criteria).
tasks.tests: New issues show template chooser with Bug Report and Feature Request options

tasks.title: Add Makefile for dev commands
tasks.details: Create Makefile with targets: test (go test ./...), fmt (gofmt -w .), lint (golangci-lint run if available), build (go build ./cmd/ralph), and ci (runs test + fmt check). Update CONTRIBUTING.md to reference these make targets.
tasks.tests: make test, make fmt, make build all execute successfully; CONTRIBUTING.md references Makefile

tasks.title: Ensure CI matches Makefile targets
tasks.details: Review and update .github/workflows/ to ensure CI runs: go test ./..., format check, and optionally govulncheck. CI commands should match what's in Makefile so contributors can run 'make ci' locally.
tasks.tests: CI workflow runs same checks as make ci; contributor can replicate CI locally

tasks.title: Create GitHub labels for contributors
tasks.details: Add labels to repository: 'good first issue', 'help wanted', 'area:cli', 'area:prompts', 'area:evals', 'area:loop', 'documentation', 'enhancement', 'bug'.
tasks.tests: Labels exist in GitHub repository settings

tasks.title: Seed good first issues
tasks.details: Create 3-5 small issues tagged 'good first issue': docs improvements, adding new example requirements file, CLI help text improvements, adding tests for uncovered code paths.
tasks.tests: At least 3 open issues with 'good first issue' label exist

tasks.title: Enhance ARCHITECTURE.md for contributors
tasks.details: Update existing ARCHITECTURE.md to include: 'where to change what' map for common modifications, entrypoint flow explanation, config/prompts locations, and safety guardrails documentation (loop limits, unsafe mode implications).
tasks.tests: ARCHITECTURE.md includes contributor-focused 'where to change what' section

tasks.title: Add RELEASING.md
tasks.details: Create RELEASING.md documenting: semantic versioning policy, how releases are cut (tags, GitHub releases), how Homebrew tap updates happen, and any automation involved.
